channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Live updates: Netanyahu fires Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Ables, Victoria Bisset, Bryan Pietsch
item.description: Yoav Gallant had emerged as one of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s fiercest and most public critics over the war in Gaza and the failure to reach a hostage deal with Hamas.

item.title: Yoav Gallant, following the announcement that he was fired from his post as defense minister, said...
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch

item.title: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced Tuesday he has fired Defense Minister Yoav Gallant. He said...
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch

item.title: Putin makes Ukraine war veteran a governor as military gains prestige
item.dc:creator: Mary Ilyushina
item.description: The “Time of Heroes” program to promote veterans from the Ukraine war is part of the Kremlin’s effort to make military service more attractive.

item.title: The world is trying to make sense of the U.S. electoral college
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch
item.description: The United States has a distinctive system for electing presidents indirectly — a source of confusion for those following the Trump-Harris race internationally.

item.title: Israelis and Palestinians find little hope in divisive U.S. election
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor, Claire Parker, Hajar Harb

item.title: Brazilian police say they’ve solved the murder of former Post contributor
item.dc:creator: Terrence McCoy
item.description: Authorities have concluded that the killings of British journalist Dom Phillips and Indigenous rights activist Bruno Pereira were an act of retaliation targeting Pereira.

item.title: Israeli strikes in eastern Lebanon are hitting civilians without warning
item.dc:creator: Abbie Cheeseman

item.title: Israel’s actions on Gaza aid ‘not good enough,’ State Department says
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Ables

item.title: Israeli forces used civilians as human shields in Gaza, Palestinians and soldiers say
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Hajar Harb, John Hudson

item.title: Diver finds and returns graduation ring lost for decades in the ocean
item.dc:creator: Daniel Wu
item.description: Alex Davis used a metal detector to find a lost graduation ring buried in Barbados. He returned it to its owner in Canada just before the man’s 83rd birthday.

item.title: Player dies after being struck by lightning during soccer match in Peru
item.dc:creator: Des Bieler
item.description: Teams in a local tournament in the Andean highlands east of Lima were leaving the pitch amid a weather delay when lightning struck, injuring several other players.

item.title: Israel ends agreement with U.N. agency for Palestinians
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Leo Sands, Rachel Pannett, Sammy Westfall
item.description: Israel said it has withdrawn from the 1967 deal legally recognizing UNRWA. The Knesset has passed legislation curbing the U.N. agency’s activities and privileges.

item.title: Russia suspected in plot to target cargo planes in Europe and the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Souad Mekhennet, Kate Brady, Joby Warrick
item.description: Officials say proxies working for Russia were likely behind bombs destined for DHL flights in Europe, and U.S.-bound planes may have been a future target.

item.title: Israel still restricting aid one week ahead of U.S. deadline
item.dc:creator: John Hudson

item.title: Israel investigates alleged document leak to foreign media
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall, Lior Soroka

item.title: As regional violence rages, Saudi Arabia pitches itself as investment hub
item.dc:creator: Susannah George

item.title: Israeli strikes in eastern Lebanon are hitting civilians without warning
item.dc:creator: Abbie Cheeseman
item.description: At least 10 of 14 strikes Friday that caused casualties in the northern Bekaa Valley were outside the Israeli military’s evacuation zone, a Post review found.

item.title: Why the U.S. election is so long and others around the world are so short
item.dc:creator: Mikhail Klimentov
item.description: The end of a U.S. election season can feel like the final leg of a marathon. That’s because the U.S. stands out among global democracies for its long campaigns.

item.title: Protesters hurl mud at Spain’s king, queen and prime minister after floods
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan
item.description: King Felipe, Queen Letizia and Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez were met with anger in Paiporta, a town badly hit by the devastating floods in Valencia.

item.title: Pro-E.U. candidate wins Moldova runoff despite fears of Russian interference
item.dc:creator: Mary Ilyushina
item.description: Maia Sandu led with 55.41 percent against Alexandr Stoianoglo, a former prosecutor general backed by the pro-Russian Party of Socialists.

item.title: Israel withdraws from 1967 deal that recognizes UNRWA; agency says it is in the dark
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands, Miriam Berger

item.title: Meet the Russian blogger accused of U.S. election interference
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel
item.description: Blogs and programs like Mikhail Zvinchuk’s Rybar represent a transformation of Russia’s information sphere amid dissatisfaction with empty state media reports.

item.title: Israeli forces used civilians as human shields in Gaza, Palestinians and soldiers say
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Hajar Harb, John Hudson

item.title: Where Trump and Harris stand on global issues ahead of the U.S. election
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit, Kelsey Ables, Niha Masih, Adela Suliman
item.description: The new president will face a host of foreign policy challenges including immigration, climate change and wars in Ukraine and the Middle East.

item.title: As U.S. election nears, ‘fascism’ is in the spotlight again
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Though former members of Trump’s administration have called him a fascist, his political prospects have not dimmed. What does that tell us about the term’s power and usefulness?

item.title: As regional violence rages, Saudi Arabia pitches itself as investment hub
item.dc:creator: Susannah George
item.description: The summit in Riyadh, known as the Future Investment Initiative, allowed the kingdom to showcase its ambitious plans to reshape its economy.
